channel.title: Writings on beach road fried toad
channel.description: Recent content in Writings on beach road fried toad

item.title: Coles Bay July 24 Video
item.description: We got away on one of the frostiest weekends of the year to Coles Bay. Shot with the Sigma 35mm 1.4 and ran through the 8mm app.

item.title: Work Derby Getaway Video
item.description: Around a week ago I returned from my work’s annual getaway. This year staying at the boss’ accommodation in Derby. I took the camera to make a quick video for socials. Was fun to have a go at shooting mountain biking. I’m finding my new Sigma 35mm f1.4 is perfect for this kind of video.

item.title: November Sprinkler • Sigma 35mm f1.4
item.description: A warm Saturday in November. Some shots on my new Sigma 35mm f1.4 on my a7sIII.

item.title: Arm River Track Hike
item.description: Last weekend Dad and I hiked to Pelion Hut via the Arm River Track. The weather was forecast to be overcast and light showers for all 3 days – but I have never had such great weather up in the highlands. Max of 13-14 degs and almost no wind. On the Friday we walked in via the Arm River Track, about a 10-11km walk in the end. We eventually found a camp spot just outside Pelion Hut.

item.title: Northdown Beach Video
item.description: I installed the latest firmware udpate to my Sony a7iii (with much difficulty) to get the new intervalometer feature. Using it to try out a new video format idea I have had. Put simply, a series of timelapse sequences - all from the same scene. But the timelapses are short interval, around 1 second, longer than your average burst mode yet short enough to cover 10-20 seconds of action. Combining the nostalgic quality of photos and the immersive effect of video.

item.title: About this page
item.description: Beach Road Fried Toad. This is my corner of the internet. A place which isn’t social media to leave whatever I have been working on or doing, in a format which lends itself to archive more than attention. Video, photo, family, home, travels, food, music, projects – anything really. Minimal text, minimal fluff. Some kind of diary, some kind of blog. by easy.
